name: OscarBait
title: Oscar Bait
content: Movies specifically engineered to attract Oscar nominations resulting in more serious, depressing, or "artistic" movies. They're called Oscar Bait, and the practice is also derisively known as "Oscarbation".

name: NewOldWest
title: New Old West
content: A trope where contemporary settings blend with elements of the Western genre, often exploring the tension between old frontier values and modern society.

name: RoofHopping
title: Roof Hopping
content: Action sequences that involve characters running and jumping from one rooftop to another, often seen in chase scenes.

name: WidgetSeries
title: Widget Series
content: A show that is so full of cultural quirks and idiosyncrasies that it's often fascinatingly bizarre to those outside its home culture.
movies: Monty Python's The Meaning of Life (1983)

name: LeFilmArtistique
title: Le Film Artistique
content: A trope for films that are highly stylized and artistic, sometimes to the point of being incomprehensible or pretentious.

name: MinionWithAnFInEvil
title: Minion With An F In Evil
content: A villain's henchperson who is comically inept at being bad or has too gentle a nature, failing at being evil.

name: SharpDressedMan
title: Sharp Dressed Man
content: A character who dresses in a sophisticated, fashionable manner, signifying their confidence or competence.

name: SexlessMarriage
title: Sexless Marriage
content: A marriage depicted in media where the couple is shown to have little to no sexual relationship, often for comedic or dramatic effect.

name: BrieferThanTheyThink
title: Briefer Than They Think
content: When a period of history (real or fictional) is given such weight and importance as to make it seem to have lasted a lot longer than it really did.

name: TheRemake
title: The Remake
content: A new version of a previously made film or series, which may update or change the story or setting for a contemporary audience.

name: Improv
title: Improv
content: Scenes or entire works that are created spontaneously, without a script, often in comedy.

name: SchmuckBait
title: Schmuck Bait
content: A trope involving an obvious trap or a too-good-to-be-true scenario that only a 'schmuck' would fall for.

name: UnsympatheticComedyProtagonist
title: Unsympathetic Comedy Protagonist
content: A protagonist in a comedy who is intentionally flawed, unlikable, or morally ambiguous, but still the central character.
movies: Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy (2004)

name: DeanBitterman
title: Dean Bitterman
content: A stock character in academic settings, typically a dean or headmaster, who is often antagonistic or overly strict.

name: OutWithABang
title: Out With A Bang
content: A trope where a character meets their end during or immediately after a sexual encounter.

name: MagicalNegro
title: Magical Negro
content: A trope in which a supporting black character exists primarily to aid white protagonists, often with mystical or spiritual powers.

name: ThanatosGambit
title: Thanatos Gambit
content: A plan that takes into account the planner's own death, typically to ensure victory even if they don't survive.

name: FlashedBadgeHijack
title: Flashed Badge Hijack
content: When a law enforcement character commandeers a vehicle or takes over a situation by showing their badge.

name: NumberofTheBeast
title: Number of The Beast
content: The use of the number 666 to signify evil or herald the coming of dark events.

name: CrooksAreBetterArmed
title: Crooks Are Better Armed
content: Criminals in a story are often depicted with better, more advanced weaponry than the police or heroes.

name: HaHaHaNo
title: Ha Ha Ha No
content: A character seems to go along with a joke or ridiculous suggestion before suddenly turning serious and rejecting it.

name: MsFanService
title: Ms. Fanservice
content: A character, often female, included in a work to appeal to the audience's sexual interests. The design and presentation of the character focus on highlighting their attractiveness, using revealing outfits, suggestive poses, or the 'male gaze' camera work. This character often serves as a point of visual interest and can sometimes detract from the plot or other character development.
